instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
Have this board which shows no sign of water damage.
Wifi was working fine yesterday.
OS X reports no Wifi hardware installed.
What I have done:
- Tried different Wifi card
- Tried different Wifi/Camera cable
- Measured L3401 which seems fine 0.9 Ohms on each side (0,4V when turned on)
- Replaced <CHIP>U3401</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3402</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q3455</TRANSISTOR>

Any idea where to go from here?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Ahh, I'm getting lazy :), L3404 is broken, to be continued...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: And everything works perfectly, I can just hear Louis, "use your brain instead of just replacing shit" :D
